conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D interior: walls have height and thickness, rooms read as volumes, and the view is an elevated angled/isometric-like perspective with the ceiling/roof removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall extrusions with thickness and multi-face surfaces; good cutaway presentation. Minor simplifications/softened edges in some wall junctions.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall core residential layout (kitchen/nook-left, central living, master suite top-right, secondary bedrooms right/lower) is largely consistent, but the 2-car garage and exterior covered patio areas are not represented, and some room boundaries/identities (e.g., study vs bedroom use) appear altered/simplified.

interior_elements.notes: Beds, seating, kitchen counters/appliances, and bathroom fixtures are present and mostly placed in plausible corresponding rooms; some furniture/room-identity mismatches (study shown as sleeping space) reduce fidelity.

visual_clarity.notes: Readable geometry with distinct floors/walls/openings and good visibility; lighting is adequate. Minor softness/blur and simplified window/door detailing.

detected_errors.description: Major space missing: the 2-car garage from the 2D plan is not visible/represented in the 3D model.
Some layout fidelity loss due to simplification: certain room boundaries/proportions and room identities (e.g., study vs bedroom) do not clearly match the 2D plan.
Door/window placement and sizing appear generally consistent but are not verifiable as exact; several openings look simplified relative to the plan.

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with strong volumetric rendering and a mostly faithful core layout, but with notable omissions (garage/patios) and some room-identity/proportion simplifications.
